import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly_express as pxs

df.head()
source.b6a35de8:
# slicing the dataset to get only data for 2018 and 2019 season 
df_1=df.loc[df.season>2017]
source.e82b2a00:
#Slicing the dataset to find out no of wicket each player has taken in Powerplay
df_2=df_1.loc[(df_1.ov_c=="Powerplay")&(df_1.player_out.notnull())&(df_1.kind !='run out')&(df_1.kind !='retired hurt' )]
df_2[df.season==2018].bowler.value_counts()
source.d35b5aa4:
#slicing the bowling data of Deepak Chahar
dc=df.loc[(df.bowler=='DL Chahar')]
source.a94af1cf:
#Groupby dc with season and ov_c so that you can find the no of ball bowled in each season and part of the match(Powerplay,middleovers,deathovers)
dc_s=pd.DataFrame(dc.groupby(['season','ov_c']).ov_c.count())
dc_s.columns=['no']
dc_s.reset_index(inplace=True)
source.ff3d2ea3:
#plotting the above data
sns.barplot('season','no',hue='ov_c',data=dc_s)
plt.ylabel("NO of balls bowled")
fig=plt.gcf()
fig.set_size_inches(15,7)
source.2015920d:
# This gives the percentage of balls Deppak Chahar had bowled in each part of the match(Poweplay,Middle,Death_overs)
(dc.ov_c.value_counts(normalize=True)*100)
source.c8163d86:
#ploting the above 
(dc.ov_c.value_counts(normalize=True)*100).plot(kind="bar")
plt.title("Deppak chahars overs categorisation")
plt.ylabel("(Percentage)No of balls bowled")
fig=plt.gcf()
fig.set_size_inches(15,7)
source.51604dfe:
#To calculate the srikerate of chahar in each part of the match
dc.ov_c.value_counts()/dc.loc[(dc.player_out.notnull())&(dc.kind !='run out')].ov_c.value_counts()
source.f69bd1f7:
#ploting the above(strikerate)
dc_o=pd.DataFrame(dc.ov_c.value_counts()/dc.loc[(dc.player_out.notnull())&(dc.kind !='run out')].ov_c.value_counts())
dc_o.drop(['Middle_overs'],inplace=True)
dc_o.plot(kind='bar')
plt.ylabel("Strike rate")
source.9aeb8123:
#No of wickets DC has taken in powerplay,death_overs,middleovers
dc.loc[(dc.player_out.notnull())&(dc.kind !='run out')].ov_c.value_counts()
source.9d9c4226:
#plotting the percentage of the wickets taken in each part of the match
ofd=dc.loc[(dc.player_out.notnull())&(dc.kind !='run out')].ov_c.value_counts(normalize=True)*100
ofd.plot(kind="bar")

plt.ylabel("Percentage(No of wickets taken)")
plt.title("Percentage of the wickets taken in each part of the match")
source.1868230c: This shows Deepak Chahar is very good bowler in powerplays because he has the highest wickets in both 2018 and 2019 joint together.
source.3eb50a3a: The above graph shows that Deepak Chahar had bowled mostly( 80.8%)in powerplay overs, from this you can't conclude that Chahar is a good new-ball bowler, we should dig in deep.
source.faa46dbf:
The above graph shows that Deepak Chahar has a good strike rate in powerplays and even though he has only bowled fewer balls in death overs comparing it with powerplays still **8.42** is an incredible strike rate.
***Note:*** Strike rate in middle-overs is inf because he didn't pick any wickets till date in middle overs and didn't bowl many deliveries.
source.b7509f38: Eventhough  deppak chahar has only played  4 seasons(consistently for only last two seasons) i found out deepak evolved as a bowler over the years.In the first two seasons he didnt get much chance but after getting chance to play consistently in every matches he proved his potential as newball bowler who can swing the ball in both ways and even bowled at death really well with strikerate of 8.2 whenever he got a chance.
source.00fc219b: The above graph shows us that Deepak Chahar had mostly bowled in powerplay because he is swing bowler who can move the ball in both ways only in the last season(2019) he bowled some overs at death and middle this shows he is growing over the years as a bowler (adding yorkers,slower balls into his armory) only then he can bowl at every stage of the game.
